meanings.definition: A short sword or dagger with a tapering blade and a hilt with a guard, used in the medieval period.
meanings.sent1: The knight carried an anlace at his side during battles.
meanings.sent2: In the museum, you can see an anlace displayed among the ancient weapons.
meanings.sent3: The blacksmith mistakenly used the anlace to cut bread, causing a humorous scene.
meanings.sent4: Her words were as sharp as an anlace, cutting through the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The glint of the anlace in the sunlight made it look like a tiny, deadly dragon.

meanings.definition: To fasten or secure with an anlace.
meanings.sent1: She decided to anlace the curtains to keep out the bright morning sun.
meanings.sent2: The sailor anlaced the ropes tightly to secure the boat to the dock.
meanings.sent3: The chef anlaced the apron around his waist in a comical fashion.
meanings.sent4: His words anlaced her heart, binding her to him forever.
meanings.sent5: The friendship between them was anlaced with trust and loyalty.
